Bolaget har cirka 2 100 anställda med huvudkontor i Visby. För mer information, besök https://om.svenskaspel.se Kan du hjälpa oss förutsäga framtiden? Svenska Spel är på väg ut på en ny spelmarknad och för att vi ska vara konkurrenskraftiga behöver vi det bästa laget. Därför söker vi inom Affärsområde TUR nu en data scientist som vill vara en del av att driva vårat analysarbete uppåt och framåt. Du kommer ingå i ett team med analytiker och BI-utvecklare som tillsammans skapar insikter och hjälper Svenska Spel utvecklas och blomstra på framtidens spelmarknad.  Nu söker vi dig som vill jobba i en modern, datadriven organisation och som drivs av att förvandla data till meningsfull information! I den här rollen får du chansen att jobba med några av Sveriges mest välkända och omtyckta varumärken såsom Triss, Lotto, Keno, Eurojackpot och Vikinglotto.  Jobba för en större upplevelse Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter är att skapa insikter kring våra kunder och produkter. Det kan du göra genom att lokalisera rätt information utifrån olika datakällor, använda statistisk modellering och genom att alltid vrida och vända på frågeställningar ett extra varv. Du har förmågan att skapa sammanhang och meningsfulla insikter utifrån stora mängder data men samtidigt en blick för de små detaljer som påverkar. Du arbetar i nära samarbete med verksamheten och kan förmedla slutsatser och insikter på ett sådant sätt att de når och skapar värde för mottagare över hela organisationen.  Är du den vi söker?  Du är analytisk, målmedveten och strukturerad samt drivs av att ständigt bli bättre. Du är en person som tar ansvar och själv driver ditt arbete framåt. Din stora drivkraft är att undersöka och förstå data och du vet att dataanalys kräver uthållighet, noggrannhet och fokuserat arbete men att belöningen kommer i form av nya, intressanta insikter. Du arbetar självständigt samtidigt som du trivs att jobba i tvärfunktionell miljö där du utvecklas av att byta kunskap, inspirera andra och hela tiden utveckla befintliga lösningar och arbetssätt.  Du har:  Akademisk utbildning inom relevant område (datavetenskap, systemvetenskap, statistik etc) Dokumenterad erfarenhet av SQL, det är en stor fördel att även ha arbetat i Python och/eller R samt Tableau God förmåga att kommunicera, visualisera och presentera dina resultat/analyser. Mycket god förmåga att identifiera och definiera affärsproblem och omsätta dessa till analytiska frågeställningar.   Upplev Svenska Spel  Att jobba på Svenska Spel rymmer många upplevelser. Vi är svenska folkets spelbolag som förebygger spelproblem, sponsrar idrottsrörelsen på alla nivåer och låter vinsten gå tillbaka till samhället. Hos oss kan du känna pulsen, våga drömma stort och stolt erbjuda spel som är till glädje för alla. Vi är omtänksamma kollegor som tar fram det bästa hos varandra, vi har ledare som utmanar och stöttar, vi investerar i dig, din hälsa och kompetens. Du kommer spela en viktig roll när vi skriver nästa kapitel i Svenska Spels historia. Nu satsar vi framåt för en ännu större upplevelse – för våra kunder, för samhället, för dig.   Ansökan och kontaktuppgifter Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med placering på vårt kontor i Solna. Är du den vi söker, tveka inte att ansöka då du har chansen att bli delaktig i vår spännande resa framåt. Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, dock senast den 7 april 2019. p_d62b8ec1093f258d: We are now looking for a Combined Data Engineer / Ab Initio Developer for Operational Data Lake! p_8f5663cac2179e9c: Improving our potential as a learning organising is central to meeting Spotify’s Mission to unlock the potential of human creativity—by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the opportunity to enjoy and be inspired by it. Business leaders and product teams depend on learnings to inform their daily decisions by understanding how people experience music through products.  Good data is the starting place for great insights. Having a strong data for insights practice across the company will enable our insights teams to produce high quality learnings quickly and scale efficiently. We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join the band and lead us on the journey to be masters of this practice.  What you’ll do: Working across our embedded community of data scientists and engineers — and partnering closely with central tooling and infrastructure teams — you’ll lead Spotify’s effort to minimize duplication and hours spent on discovering, generating and preparing data to a state where it’s optimised for insights.  By engaging across disciplines you’ll develop a practice that’s easy for others to adopt and is equally easy for others to contribute to. You’ll build and maintain an evolving set of shared principles, shared tools, shared knowledge and most importantly shared behaviours for how we produce and handle data for insights across the company.  To take on the data for insights challenges at Spotify, we’ll need to work across the entire data preparation workflow, including generating data through instrumentation, normalising data into easy to query tables and producing flat tables that are ready to analyse. When light touch support to the community is not enough, you will embed in other teams to solve problems and develop new community resources as a result. When input to central support teams is not enough, we embed with our partners there to help design, build and activate shared data, tooling and /or infrastructure.  You’ll work with data scientists to cultivate a shared practice for defining data collection requirements across all of our experiences. You’ll partner with central tooling and infrastructure teams to make sure it’s trivially easy for these requirements to be implemented by product teams.  You’ll work with dedicated data production teams to find opportunity to produce datasets centrally. You’ll be the lead designer for Spotify’s data, modelling data across the company and helping teams to identify and design data interoperability with their bounded context. You’ll work closely with tooling and infrastructure teams to ensure we have the tools we need to make it easy to produce and handle data for insights. When input is not enough, you’ll embed with our partners to help design, build or activate shared data, tooling and infrastructure.  Who you are You’re passionate about the role of modelled, analyst friendly data in maximizing a company’s potential as a learning organisation. Your passion for good practice is infectious. As you continuously improve your own practice, Spotify’s practice will improve alongside you. You’re collaborative. You work hands on with a wide variety of teams to ensure that both the most recent needs of the community are reflected in our shared practice and that behaviours of the community are changing to adopt it. When there are competing shared practices you facilitate discussions, providing your experienced perspective where needed, in order to establish a single view, e.g. the guiding principles or when to use which practice. When infrastructure is missing or incomplete you surface the needs and work with infra teams to ensure that they are understood. You’re innovative. You’re a builder. You show people the value of your ideas by bringing them to life in tangible, innovative ways. You work closely with central engineering and infrastructure teams to pursue the most complex challenges at Spotify are addressed in a sustainable way. You’re playful. You’re always looking for new ways to engage across disciplines to build engagement and cultivate a shared sense of ownership of the practice. You’re sincere. As community lead, you take an active interest in your own development and the development of other data scientists across the organisation. Qualifications 5+ years as a practicing data scientist, analyst or data/analytics engineer. A high level of ability in data science languages such as SQL and Python and/or R. Some previous experience leading data scientists in developing and adopting shared practice is needed (e.g. building an internal community of practice, contributing to open source) Extensive experience working with engineers, product managers and designers in a product environment to decide what data to collect and how to collect it, to enable the data science downstream. Ideally you have 2+ years experience with data modelling in a variety of contexts (e.g. web sites, applications, financial) and ideally in variety of use cases (e.g. preparing data for your own ad hoc data science projects, enterprise data warehousing and/or modelling data for software applications). Ideally you have a strong command of Domain-Driven Design principles, with experience applying it to software or data design at an enterprise scale.

p_c4fbaf2c8ddc9783: What we do at Detectify Detectify was born from the simple idea that the internet is broken. Our founders are some of the best ethical hackers out there. Between them, they have hacked some of the biggest tech companies in the world and now they are sharing their knowledge as part of our tech teams. The knowledge they accumulated from ethical hacking turned into an application security tool that automates hacker-attacks. Today, in addition to our internal research, we collaborate with a global group of handpicked white-hat hackers to gather security tests. Our tool is trusted and used by some of the most widely known companies such as Spotify, Trello, and King. Based in central Stockholm, Sweden, we are currently a team of 50 employees and growing quickly. What our data team does The team works horizontally throughout the company by promoting a data-driven culture and identifying business needs. The main mission of the team is to provide insights and recommendations to the sales, marketing and product departments, so they can make impactful decisions. We achieve our mission by taking care of the data collection and storage, batch and stream processing, infrastructure monitoring, data analytics, as well as modelling and visualisation. Role and Responsibility As a Data Scientist you will have the unique opportunity to work in a team that is responsible for understanding business needs and translate them into data-driven tools and recommendations. Your stakeholders will be all the other tech, marketing and sales teams. In this role, you will be responsible for making sure that your stakeholders can take data-driven decisions, by: Translating business needs into quantitative terms and data requirements Identifying and formulating technical requirements to our tech teams Proactively identifying relevant questions, providing analysis and insight Designing experiments to test product features Implementing and maintaining advanced statistical models Aggregating and enhancing big data with external sources Building fault-tolerant pipelines Ensuring data quality Communicating results in a clear and effective way Some of the languages and technologies that we use are Python, Pandas, scikit-learn, SciPy, SQL, NoSQL, Elasticsearch, AWS S3, Glue, Athena, Django, D3.js and ETL frameworks as Luigi and third-party tools like Google Analytics. Who you are You are a creative person who sets and achieves ambitious goals in a collaborative and challenging environment. You continuously evaluate and reflect on your own solutions and seek recommendations to improve your skills. Your background Education in math, statistics, physics or similar quantitative disciplines Able to write readable and maintainable code Experience with some or all the technologies mentioned above You can explain technical findings to a non-technical team A genuine interest in learning and experimenting new technologies You are a team player So, what do you think? If you wish to be a part of this innovative, problem-solving tech team helping other developers to build a more secure internet, send us your contact details through the application below and we’ll take it from there. This is going to be fun!

p_6107e6f167eaca03: Date: Mar 1, 2019 We welcome the opportunity to meet you! http://www.ericsson.com/careers  Why is Ericsson a good place to work: Ericsson enables communications service providers to capture the full value of connectivity. The company’s portfolio spans Networks, Digital Services, Managed Services, and Emerging Business and is designed to help our customers go digital, increase efficiency, find new revenue streams, and create new user experiences. Ericsson’s investments in innovation have delivered the benefits of telephony and mobile broadband to billions of people around the world ensuring our solutions – and our customers – are at the forefront of innovation. We support networks that connect more than 2.5 billion subscribers. With close to 100,000 employees and customers in 180 countries, we combine global scale with technology and service leadership. 40 percent of the world’s mobile traffic is carried over an Ericsson network. And, our Technology for Good and Connect to Learn programs include creating technology that makes it easier to save lives, feed societies, bring technology to emerging markets and connectivity to remote areas, and grow businesses and prosperity. At Ericsson, we give our employees the freedom to think big and navigate their career, on a global scale. We create technology that helps others, from helping people enjoy their favourite content to helping people recover from natural disasters by enabling better communications between rescue workers. Your ideas and innovations can turn into achievements that impact society and change the world, creating new connections, new possibilities, and new capabilities. Next generation technology can be staggeringly complex. But the simpler it is to use; the more people benefit from it. Join us and help build technology that makes it simple to connect with information, business, societies, and each other.  Position Summary: Global AI Accelerator Ericsson is now looking for Data Scientists to significantly expand its Global AI Accelerator team. Do you have in depth understanding of ML and AI technologies? Do you want to apply and extend those skills to solve real world, complex problems with high societal impact; going beyond ML/AI for consumption and advertising? Then, you do want to join Ericsson’s global team of Data Scientists pushing the technology frontiers to automate, simplify and add new value through large and complex data. You are a data scientist who gets inspired by large datasets, solving complex problems in a cross functional team of data scientists and subject matter experts. You like pushing the latest technology boundaries in the data science field. You have a few years’ experience of applying machine learning in practice. In this role you will be applying machine learning in the telecommunications network domain. We are constantly looking for new ways to improve and automate current and future generations of radio systems, managed services, IoT and support no solutions.  Our Exciting Opportunity: In the fifth-generation mobile networks 5G, AI technologies are an integral part of making the networks meet the new challenges and deliver performance that far exceeds networks of today. 5G networks with distributed edge compute, will drive economic and social transformation for all aspects of society. Machine Learning (ML) and other Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies will be vital for us to handle this opportunity. Already today, in order to create value from data in real time, we use several methods including reinforcement learning, deep learning, semantic reasoning and more conventional learning techniques. By using these technologies, we are able to maximize the output for each function in our highly distributed and decentralized networks making them more resilient, adaptive and optimized than has ever been possible before. Machine Learning and other AI technologies also allows us to fuel new innovation we can’t imagine today.  To even more accelerate this, we are setting up a Global AI Accelerator, to fast-track our strategy execution.  Purpose of the Job Role: As a Data Scientist, you will need to have strong programming skills and deep understanding of data science and Machine Learning tools. Have proven experience in Data Science methodologies and how to apply them to solve challenging real-world problems as part of a highly dynamic and global team. You have strong communication, collaboration and planning skills. You will be working on high impact initiatives with other specialists in Machine Intelligence to drive growth and economic profitability for Ericsson and its customers by accelerating current Ericsson offerings as well create new offerings in the areas of MI driven 4G and 5G network, distributed cloud, IoT and other emerging businesses.  Responsibilities & Tasks: Conduct functional and technical analysis within Ericsson organization and strategic customers to understand MI-driven business needs and opportunities Contribute to rapid and iterative development of high quality ML/AI applications. This includes working with petabytes of 4G/5G-networks, IoT and exogenous data, and proposing/selecting/testing predictive models, recommendation engines, anomaly detection systems, statistical model, deep learning, reinforcement learning and other machine learning systems Conduct studies and find creative usage of new and/or existing data sources. Work with Data Architects to leverage existing data models and build new ones, as needed. Collaborate with product development teams and partners in Ericsson Businesses to industrialize machine learning models and solutions as part of Ericsson offerings including providing source code, workflows and documents Work with new technologies and champion them in MI Communities within Ericsson. Assist MI Competence build-up in Ericsson Businesses and Customer Serving Units Help to develop new and apply/extend existing, concepts, methodologies, techniques for cross functional initiatives Engage with external ecosystem (academia, technology leaders, open source etc.) to develop the skills and technology portfolio for MI’s needs  Position Qualifications: CORE COMPETENCIES Strong skills in Machine Learning especially techniques such as Linear/Logistic Regression, Bagging, Bayesian model, Neural Networks, Random forest, Gradient boosting, Hyperparameter optimization techniques etc. Proven skills and track record (Github, open source etc.) in the use of current state of the art machine learning frameworks such as Keras, TensorFlow, Scikit-Learn, H2o, Spark etc. in developing ML/AI applications Experience of data wrangling and data munging, using Big Data technologies Strong analytical skills and ability to acquire new knowledge and apply it in the job Programming skills in various languages (C++, Scala, Java, R) with proficiency in Python and/or C++ Good communication skills in written and spoken English Creativity and ability to formulate problems and solve them independently Ability to develop and drive new ways of working, to produce deliverables in a more efficient way  MINIMUM QUALIFICATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS MSc, or PhD in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Computer Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, or related field (e.g. applied mathematics/statistics) 1 to 3 years of real world or research experience in data science.  PREFERRED QUALIFICATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS Experience with data visualization and dashboard creation Certifying MI MOOCS, a plus Applications/Domain-knowledge in Telecommunication and/or IoT, a plus. Ability to build and nurture internal and external communities Experience in writing and presenting white papers, journal articles and technical blogs on the results Ability to work in a collaborative environment, i.e., working with complex multiple stakeholder business units, global customers, technology and other ecosystem partners in a multi-culture, global matrix organization with sensitivity and persistence  Location: Stockholm, Kista Application: Please submit your application in English as soon as possible - we are working continuously with candidate selection. p_dda73fc3a1264b38: Accenture Applied Intelligence is looking for business-driven Data Science consultants in Stockholm   Accenture Digital is one of Accenture’s five growth platforms and offers comprehensive portfolio of business and technology services across Digital marketing, eCommerce, Mobility services and Applied intelligence.   Applied intelligence -practice at Accenture help our clients grow their business in new ways – by enabling them to achieve better performance through insights from data. Accenture works with organizations to develop analytic capabilities - from accessing and reporting on data to predictive modelling – to outperform the competition.   We will give you the opportunity to grow personally and professionally in a dynamic environment. Our projects are built on cooperation and teamwork and you will find yourself working together with other talented, passionate and dedicated consultants, all working towards a shared goal.   Accenture Applied Intelligence   Accenture’s Applied Intelligence is looking to expand the Nordic team with Data Scientist consultants, with both academic and minimum 2-3 years practical experience in one or more topics such as customer insight, advanced analytics, storytelling & data visualization. It would also be an advantage if you are familiar with artificial intelligence and/or machine learning.   In the right hands (yours!) and handled strategically, the massive amounts of information our clients collect today can become their most valuable new asset. The ability to gain actionable insights from that data is critical to produce tangible results. If you are passionate about helping clients make faster, smarter decisions to tackle their most complex business issues, we want to meet you.   As a Data Scientist, your key responsibilities include:   Creating value for our clients by providing new insights from predictive statistical modeling activities Working with client stakeholders to identify business issues Translating business issues into specific requirements to develop the analytics solutions Ensuring successful deployment and adoption of solution at clients Testing theories by creating models and experimenting with data Designing the models, algorithms and visualizations that help companies distill insights from huge volumes of chaotic data Involving in gathering big data. Formulating high business impact cluster or nodes and establish performance checks on the large data model Leveraging industry knowledge that is shaped by analytics exposure through prior experiences  To work as a Data Scientist, we also expect you to:   Be passionate about helping clients bring value from their data! Explain complex concepts in non-technical language Have a quantitative ability, with deep understanding of analytics techniques, such as clustering, predictive modeling, and optimization Have strong and broad knowledge of digital technology trends applied to client and business context Have previous experience of working with analytics tools such as: Python R SAS EM SPSS Alteryx   Above this we also want you to:   Have a master’s degree or PhD. from a relevant field such as Business, Physics, Math or Technology Enjoy working in diverse teams Have excellent written and presentation skills in both Swedish and English Have strong interest in growing your own technology, industry and sales skills   Why Accenture?   Because people enjoy working here; the work we do is challenging, interesting and meaningful. Accenture offers a unique career experience and unparalleled opportunity for you to grow and advance. Location: Stockholm, Sweden  Director of R&D - Stockholm, Sweden  We are looking for an exceptional scientist and manager to lead research and development at our Stockholm R&D facility. The ideal candidate will have a proven track-record of leading teams of scientists that have successfully developed creative and novel computational and molecular biology-based technologies for solving complex biological problems. The candidate must combine impressive technical leadership, excellence in people management, a strong drive for making great products and deep familiarity with next-generation sequencing applications. This position will interact closely with senior leadership at our Pleasanton HQ, as well as our global R&D, product management, marketing and technical support staff.  Key Responsibilities   Establish and maintain the necessary team structures, processes, infrastructure and environment to drive development of industry-leading assays for the 10x Genomics technology platforms, with emphasis on spatial transcriptomics. Manage and mentor scientists and engineers matrixed into multiple multi-disciplinary product development and research teams. Conceive, initiate and oversee early stage research and development of novel/optimized assay schemes, workflows, reagents and algorithms. Oversee collaborative research and development with local industry and academic partners. Oversee recruitment, onboarding and continual training of world-class computational and molecular biologists. Contribute to establishment and maintenance of strong lines of communication, knowledge-sharing and collaboration between global R&D facilities. Contribute to planning and monitoring of site- and project-specific budgets and staffing plans. Contribute expertise to company-wide strategic planning and development of product roadmaps. Collaborate with internal functional teams including molecular biology, computational biology, product integration, microfluidics and chemistry to establish company-wide best practices for experimental design and execution, documentation, laboratory information management, resource utilization and environmental health and safety.  Required Skills and Background   PhD in biotechnology, genomics, molecular biology or a similar field. A minimum of 5 years post-graduate experience in the life sciences industry, including a minimum of 2 years in a technical leadership position with direct reports. Proven ability to plan and execute highly technical development projects, as evidenced by published patents, peer-reviewed articles or launched products. Proven ability to manage functional or project-based teams of 10 or more scientists in a matrix environment. Experience with molecular biology assays/protocols utilizing next-generation sequencing. Experience with computational analysis of complex data sets. Strong organizational skills. Strong interpersonal skills, including written and oral communication. Ability to work in a fast-paced and quickly changing environment. Ability to travel to Pleasanton, CA for at least one week every six months. A strong desire to build game-changing technologies and impact the world of life science research.  Desired Skills and Background   Experience in tissue analysis using quantitative microscopy, in situ RNA or protein assays, spatial transcriptomics or similar techniques. Experience in single-cell genomics, functional genomics or immunology. Experience in formal design of experiment (DOE) methodologies. Formal coursework or training in people management.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

p_5deebba6c4e9667e: Date: Mar 1, 2019 We welcome the opportunity to meet you! http://www.ericsson.com/careers  Why is Ericsson a good place to work: Ericsson enables communications service providers to capture the full value of connectivity. The company’s portfolio spans Networks, Digital Services, Managed Services, and Emerging Business and is designed to help our customers go digital, increase efficiency, find new revenue streams, and create new user experiences. Ericsson’s investments in innovation have delivered the benefits of telephony and mobile broadband to billions of people around the world ensuring our solutions – and our customers – are at the forefront of innovation. We support networks that connect more than 2.5 billion subscribers. With close to 100,000 employees and customers in 180 countries, we combine global scale with technology and service leadership. 40 percent of the world’s mobile traffic is carried over an Ericsson network. And, our Technology for Good and Connect to Learn programs include creating technology that makes it easier to save lives, feed societies, bring technology to emerging markets and connectivity to remote areas, and grow businesses and prosperity. At Ericsson, we give our employees the freedom to think big and navigate their career, on a global scale. We create technology that helps others, from helping people enjoy their favorite content to helping people recover from natural disasters by enabling better communications between rescue workers. Your ideas and innovations can turn into achievements that impact society and change the world, creating new connections, new possibilities, and new capabilities. Next generation technology can be staggeringly complex. But the simpler it is to use; the more people benefit from it. Join us and help build technology that makes it simple to connect with information, business, societies, and each other.  Position Summary: Data Engineer at Global AI Accelerator Unit  Would you like to change the way the world is connected? 5G is going to be a game changer in the world of connectivity. Do you want to be an influencer in making product and design decisions to run, optimize and manage 5G Networks? If yes, we have a place for you.  It will be practically impossible for human brains to understand how to run and optimize a 5G network, Machine Learning (ML) and other Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies- will be vital for us to handle that complexity. We are setting up a Global AI Accelerator in the US, Sweden and India, with 300 experts, to fast-track our strategy execution towards the adoption of Machine Learning (ML) and other Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies with in the portfolio of Ericsson Products (https://www.ericsson.com/en/portfolio) in the areas of 5G Networks, Managed Services, Digital Services, IoT and Emerging Business. You will work closely with Domain experts, Product Managers, Data Scientists and Researchers to solve some of the mostly challenging problems in the areas in the telecom domain. You will have opportunity to work in the technology that will touch the lives of billons of people and connected things as well.  Machine Intelligence at Ericsson Machine Intelligence (MI), the combination of Machine Learning and other Artificial Intelligence technologies is what Ericsson uses to drive thought leadership to automate and transform Ericsson offerings and operations. MI is a key competence to enable new and emerging business. This includes development of models, frameworks and infrastructure that we use to power our 5G networks and services. We engage in both academic and industry collaborations to drive the digitalization of Ericsson and the Industry. Our global group develop state of the art solutions that simplify and automate processes in our products and services and create new value through data insights.  Ericsson is looking for Data Engineers to join our growing team of MI experts to significantly expand its Global AI Accelerator team.  Job Description: Ericsson is looking for savvy Data Engineers to join our growing team of MI experts. As a team member, you will be evolving and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as, optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. You are an expert data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and evolving them. The Data Engineer will support our software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data and models devOps (dataOps) architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects. You are self-directed and comfortable supporting the dataOps needs of multiple teams, systems and products. You will also be responsible for integrating them with the architecture used across the company. The right candidate will be excited by the prospect of optimizing or even re-designing our company’s dataOps architecture to support our existing and next generation of MI-driven products and solutions initiatives.  Your Roles and Responsibilities Gaining a good understanding of business processes and domain knowledge by working with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams Contributing to the data warehouse design and data preparation by implementing a solid, robust, extensible design that supports key business flows. Assist with the creation and maintaining of complex data pipelines Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements. Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc. Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and cloud-based ‘big data’ technologies from AWS, Azure and others. Keep data separated and secure across national boundaries through multiple data centers and strategic customers/partners. Create tool-chains for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader. Work with data and machine learning experts to strive for greater functionality in our data and model life cycle management systems. Build sanity checks and dashboards for monitoring data quality, pipeline performances and infrastructure health. Support DataOps competence build-up in Ericsson Businesses and Customer Serving Units  What we would like to see BS, MS or PhD degree in Computer Science, Informatics, Information Systems or another related field. 0-2 years’ experience using the following software/tools: Familiarity with NoSQL databases such as Cassandra, Solr, MongoDB, etc.. Experience with tools/software for big data processing such as Hadoop, Spark Experience with handling data streams with tools such as Flink, Spark-Streaming, Kafka or Storm Experience with Data and Model pipeline and workflow management tools such as Azkaban, Luigi. Airflow or Dataiku. Experience with Docker containers, orchestration systems (e.g. Kubernetes), continuous integration and job schedulers. Familiar with functional programming and scripting languages such as Javascript or GO Knowledge of serverless architectures (e.g. Lambda, Kinesis, Glue). Experience with microservices and REST APIs. Expert knowledge in SQL and traditional RDBMS systems Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc. (Advanced level in one language at least) Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment Advanced SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of other databases/date-sources. Experience building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures and data sets. Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and seek opportunities for improvement. Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets. Have built processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management. Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable ‘big data’ data stores. Experience in Data warehouse design and dimensional modeling Familiar with agile development and lean principles. Contributor or owner of GitHub repo.  Application The position is based in Kista, Sweden. Please submit your application until 31st of March 2019.  For specific questions please contact recruiter Miroslaw Cos Miroslaw.cos@ericsson.com. p_a5e56ddd1c7c9498: We’re looking for curious and engaged Data Scientists to join our team. Are you passionate about hands-on applications of machine learning, enjoy solving business problems and seeing the measurable impact of your work? Do you believe in empowering small businesses around the world to succeed? Join our Data Science team in Stockholm. As a Data Scientist at iZettle you develop and ship machine learning solutions for automatic predictions and decisions, and personalized user experiences you partner with product/business owners and lead data projects end-to-end: recognizing opportunities, defining metrics and goals, implementing ML solutions, and evaluating the impact you embed within multi-functional product teams to collaborate on implementing and integrating solutions you also have a team of extraordinary Data Scientist colleagues to help figure out problems, and share best practices and learnings you will continuously learn together, through our weekly research paper study group, attending conferences and events, and collaborating with academia  We hire people. Not CVs. As a Data Scientist, you'll join a team that works across the organization using machine learning to build intelligence into our products, optimize sales and marketing processes, and improve risk management. You'll be a great addition to the iZettle team if... you have hands-on experience of implementing production machine learning systems, and also a solid understanding of ML theory you are comfortable working in cross functional teams and on products with short development cycles and quickly evolving priorities you are fluent in Python or R and are eager to learn any new languages you are pragmatic, product-focused and passionate about the end results, not just the techniques used to get there you're a great communicator and you're comfortable explaining complex results, models and methods to both technical and non-technical audiences Additionally, if you have used data pipelining tools such as Apache Spark or Apache Beam/Google DataFlow, in an AWS or GCP environment, let us know. If not, we'll be happy to help you get started.  Small minds never helped small businesses It takes originality and an open mind to start a small business. That’s why small minds have no place in ours. At iZettle, we celebrate the individuality of the people we work with, valuing the impact that diverse experiences, backgrounds, perspectives and ideas can have on our culture and the products we build. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer, a place where everyone can benefit from equal access to professional development and bring their whole personality to work.  We’re iZettle. iZettle is on a mission to help small businesses succeed in a world of giants. Founded in Stockholm in 2010, we revolutionised mobile payments with the world’s first mini chip card reader and software for mobile devices. Today iZettle’s commerce platform for small businesses in Europe and Latin America provides tools to get paid, sell smarter and grow your business. We’re more than 500 employees of 45 different nationalities operating in 12 countries, and we’re looking fro talent from around the world to help us grow further.  Bring your talent to our attention. We’re a diverse team dedicated to using data to build great value for our customers and we’d love your contribution. Go on, hit apply and say hello!

p_2427d79fe8c2982f: Som Data Scientist kommer du vara en del av vårt affärsområde Business Application som är en spännande enhet specialiserad på prediktiv analys, maskininlärning och AI. Google, Microsoft och SAS är tre av våra partners men vi gör också arbeten med open source program som R och Python. Känns detta spännande och är tekniker som du brinner för kommer du definitivt att trivas på Forefront och med resten av teamet.   Vi söker dig som har Ett par års erfarenhet som data scientist/statistiker  Tidigare erfarenhet av avancerad data mining och analys såsom multivariatanalys, prediktiva modeller, maskininlärning, segmentering, textanalys eller bildigenkänning  Djup kännedom om att applicera data science inom minst en bransch och har erfarenhet av att proaktivt ta fram modeller som produktionsätts för ett ökat affärsvärde  Vana att jobba med SAS, Python eller R  Grundläggande kunskap i SQL   Det är meriterande om du har Erfarenhet av att jobba självständigt med att bygga pipelines i Azure eller Google  Deltagit i Data Science-tävlingar (Kaggle)  Data engineer-bakgrund  Arbetat som konsult   Som person är du självgående, driftig, arbetar proaktivt samt innehar ett entreprenöriellt tankesätt. Du ska vara lyhörd för kundens behov och kunna förmedla dina kunskaper på ett pedagogiskt sätt. Du vill vara med från början i kunddialogen och trivs när du behåller eget ansvar genom hela leveransen. Vi värdesätter kreativitet, förmågan att se möjligheter samt att du har lätt för att samarbeta.   Vi erbjuder dig På Forefront prioriteras din utveckling och du kommer få goda möjligheter till att utöka din portfölj av kompetenser genom utbildningar och certifieringar. Du kommer befinna dig i en miljö där du har nära till kund, kollegor, ledare och beslutsfattare.   AI är ett område där vi satsar stort, har ett bra renommé och ser en ljus framtid inom - alltså en arbetsplats där dina kompetenser kommer passa perfekt.  På det öppna huvudkontoret som ligger i hjärtat av Stockholm finns gott om härliga kollegor med varierande spetskompetenser som gärna delar med sig av sina erfarenheter och kunskaper.

p_b2efb4f291869636: Do you have experience in advanced analysis of complex big data solutions? Do you enjoy working with the latest analysis-techniques and drive change? KPMG is looking for a Senior Data Scientist. Do you fit the bill? About the position As our new Senior Data Scientist, you will get the opportunity to work with customers all over the region and Sweden. As the most senior in the team, you will be responsible for driving the architectural ideas and designs by realizing them into buildable solutions. You will be leading the work of advanced analysis models and algorithms that in turn will give insights to the increased business benefits for all of KPMG.  You will be a part of a team of analysist, but also have co-workers within varied specialist areas. At KPMG we have competence ranging from strategy and crafts to project management, architecture and development. You will get the chance to become part of one of the most competitive companies in the market.  As the new Senior Data Scientist at KPMG, you will get the chance to develop within different systems, techniques and methods within your specialist area. We see that you have knowledge of one or more of: Python, R, Java, C#, Git, Spark, SAS; MATLAB, Scala, SQL, Azure, .NET, NoSQL, MapReduce and/or Hadoop.  Who are you? We believe that you have a deep interest in information management, statistics and data driven business analysis. You are both positive, problem-solving and customer oriented. In addition to both your technical and mathematical skills, you are a good communicator who can translate data into insights and decision making that contribute to your client’s development.  We see that you have experience as a Data Scientist and are well acquainted in analysis, data and other useful methods.  It is merited if you have knowledge and experience in Machine Learning, AI and/or IoT and are also adept at presenting and communicating complex analyzes and concepts.  At KPMG we work with our clients to inspire confidence and empower change At KPMG, our values define who we are and the way we do business. What drives us is a desire to pass on business insights and provide expert audit, tax and advisory services tailored to specific industries. As a leading professional services firm, we know that our strength and capability come from our people and their different perspectives, experiences and backgrounds. From our inclusive leadership strategy to our diversity and inclusion targets, we’re making bold changes to who we are and what we do. We provide a wide range of data analytics and data modelling services to our clients in a diverse range of sectors, such as health, transport, infrastructure, communications, energy/natural resources, financial services, leisure, retail and manufacturing.  Our global network of 197 000 specialists in 154 countries makes us one of the world´s leading knowledge companies. In Sweden we have a strong local presence with 1 500 employees at several locations.
